column4: Hi all.  Because I like to share solutions, if anyone ever gets an error running SQL Developer from Oracle that looks like this:   error instantiating 'java.util.logging.FileHandler,' referenced by handlers, class not found
Just be sure your java home is set correctly.  Use env to see if you have the JAVA_HOME.  If not, add it using:   export JAVA_HOME=jdkfolderhere
put it in the forum,  use the error as the title of your post
okay, I'll do it, incase it helps someone else save some time/frustration.
that's why the forum is a good place for  "occasionnal" stuff like that
do you have a forum name?
what category do you suggest this go into?
I have no idea, do what is best , but I expect  regular search for the error msg will check everycathegory
when I connect to a remote site, copy/pasting to the site through the Terminal Server Client window and the Ubuntu system does not seem to work.
much better question,  I don'T have an answer for you
just wanted to thank you, sometimes giving help can be thankless.
I don'T allow private msg please talk to me in the chanel
